result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel T McLean was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

timeConds.notes: Time Served Sentence. 3 days credit for time served in the event of revocation.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ Case10:45 AM Defendant Daniel T McLean in court, in custody.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Daniel T McLean. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Counts 1 & 3 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Counts 2, 4, & 5 - DRI. Statement by Atty Rae. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W - 36 months probation. Conditions: As to Count 1 only: 90 days WC Jail, 93 days CFTS - time served sentence. 3 days credit for time served in the event of revocation. AODA and follow through. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Daniel T McLean in court, in custody.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Daniel T McLean. Atty Rae requests a P/S Hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 21, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - reading waived.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 02:35 pm.
Status conference on May 2, 2022 at 02:35 pm.

Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be represented by SPD if released from custody.
